alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clinton; Hamilton; Hancock; Henry; Madison; Montgomery; Rush; Tipton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 4:21AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Madison, Hancock, northwestern Rush, southern Clinton, northern Hendricks, western Henry, Marion, Boone, Hamilton, southern Tipton, southeastern Montgomery and northeastern Putnam Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 420 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Frankfort to 10 miles northwest of Danville. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Brownsburg around 435 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Noblesville, Tipton, Speedway, Elwood, Beech Grove, Alexandria, Indianapolis, Anderson, Lawrence and Greenfield. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 109 and 153. Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 232. Interstate 70 between mile markers 76 and 114. Interstate 74 between mile markers 46 and 73, and between mile markers 94 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Clinton; Hamilton; Hancock; Henry; Madison; Montgomery; Rush; Tipton
